Wisdom: الْجَوْرُ تَبِعَاتٌ
enWisdom: Tyranny brings negative consequences

Wisdom: الْجَوْرُ مُضَادُّ الْعَدْلِ
enWisdom: Tyranny is the antithesis of justice

Wisdom: الظُّلْمُ أَلْأَمُ [أُمُ‏] الرَّذَائِلِ
enWisdom: Injustice is the most wicked vice

Wisdom: الظُّلْمُ جُرْمٌ لَا يُنْسَى
enWisdom: Injustice is a crime that cannot be forgotten

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالظُّلْمَ فَإِنَّهُ يَزُولُ عَمَّنْ تَظْلِمُهُ وَيَبْقَى عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: Keep away from injustice, for indeed it will depart from the one whom you oppress and will remain upon you

Wisdom: ابْعُدُوا عَنِ الظُّلْمِ فَإِنَّهُ أَعْظَمُ الْجَرَائِمِ وَأَكْبَرُ الْمَآثِمِ
enWisdom: Distance yourselves from injustice, for indeed it is the greatest of wrongdoings and the biggest of sins

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ الظُّلْمَ ثَلَاثَةٌ فَظُلْمٌ لَا يُغْفَرُ [لا يعرف‏] وَظُلْمٌ لَا يُتْرَكُ وَظُلْمٌ مَغْفُورٌ لَا يُطْلَبُ فَأَمَّا الظُّلْمُ الَّذِي لَا يُغْفَرُ [لا يعرف‏] فَالشِّرْكُ [فالشك‏] بِاللَّهِ لِقَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَغْفِرُ أَنْ يُشْرَكَ بِهِ وَيَغْفِرُ ما دُونَ ذلِكَ لِمَنْ يَشاءُ وَأَمَّا الظُّلْمُ الَّذِي يُغْفَرُ فَظُلْمُ الْمَرْءِ لِنَفْسِهِ عِنْدَ بَعْضِ الْهَنَاتِ وَأَمَّا الظُّلْمُ الَّذِي لَا يُتْرَكُ فَظُلْمُ الْعِبَادِ بَعْضِهِمْ بَعْضاً الْعِقَابُ هُنَالِكَ شَدِيدٌ لَيْسَ جَرْحاً بِالْمُدَى وَلَا ضَرْباً بِالسِّيَاطِ وَلَكِنَّهُ مَا يُسْتَصْغَرُ ذَلِكَ مَعَهُ
enWisdom: Know that injustice is of three kinds: the injustice that is not forgiven, the injustice that is not left [unquestioned], and the injustice that is forgiven without being questionedAs for the injustice that is not forgiven, it is the ascribing of partners to Allah as He, the Most High, says: ‘Verily Allah does not forgive that any partner should be ascribed to Him, but He forgives anything besides that to whomever He wishes’As for the injustice that is forgiven, it is the injustice of a person to himself in committing some small sinsAnd as for the injustice that is not left unquestioned, it is the injustice of the people on one anotherIn this case the punishment is severe, not [simply] wounding with knives or striking with whips, rather it is a punishment in comparison to which all this seems small

Wisdom: أَخْسَرُكُمْ أَظْلَمُكُمْ
enWisdom: The biggest loser from among you is the most unjust from among you

Wisdom: أَقْبَحُ السِّيَرِ الظُّلْمُ
enWisdom: The most loathsome mode of conduct is inequity

Wisdom: أَفْحَشُ الْبَغْيِ الْبَغْيُ عَلَى الْأُلَّافِ
enWisdom: The vilest transgression is transgression against the intimate [friends]

Wisdom: أَجْوَرُ النَّاسِ مَنْ ظَلَمَ مَنْ أَنْصَفَهُ
enWisdom: The most tyrannical person is he who oppresses the one who is fair to him

Wisdom: أَجْوَرُ النَّاسِ مَنْ عَدَّ جَوْرَهُ عَدْلًا مِنْهُ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: أَظْلَمُ النَّاسِ مَنْ سَنَّ سُنَنَ الْجَوْرِ وَمَحَا سُنَنَ الْعَدْلِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَسْوَأَ الْمَعَاصِي مَغَبَّةُ الْغَيِّ
enWisdom: Verily the vice with the worst of consequences is error [and misguidance]

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْقُبْحَ فِي الظُّلْمِ بِقَدْرِ الْحُسْنِ فِي الْعَدْلِ
enWisdom: Indeed the ugliness in injustice is equivalent to the beauty in justice

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الْجَهْلِ الْجَوْرُ
enWisdom: The cornerstone of ignorance is oppression

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ يَظْلِمُ النَّاسَ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who oppresses others

Wisdom: شَرُّ أَخْلَاقِ النُّفُوسِ الْجَوْرُ
enWisdom: The most evil characteristic of the souls is oppression

Wisdom: ظَاهَرَ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ بِالْعِنَادِ مَنْ ظَلَمَ الْعِبَادَ
enWisdom: One who oppresses the people has manifested his obdurate opposition to Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَعْدِلُ فِي غَيْرِهِ مَنْ يَظْلِمُ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: How can one who is unjust to himself be just with others?!

Wisdom: مَنْ ظَلَمَ نَفْسَهُ كَانَ لِغَيْرِهِ أَظْلَمَ
enWisdom: Whoever oppresses himself is more oppressive to others

Wisdom: لِلظَّالِمِ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ ثَلَاثُ عَلَامَاتٍ يَظْلِمُ مَنْ فَوْقَهُ بِالْمَعْصِيَةِ وَمَنْ دُونَهُ بِالْغَلَبَةِ وَيُظَاهِرُ الْقَوْمَ الظَّلَمَةَ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ شَطَطُهُ كَثُرَ سَخَطُهُ
enWisdom: One whose violations increase, his exasperation [also] increases

Wisdom: مَنْ أَشْفَقَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ لَمْ يَظْلِمْ غَيْرَهُ
enWisdom: One who fears for his soul does not oppress others

Wisdom: مَنْ ظَلَمَ الْعِبَادَ كَانَ اللَّهُ خَصْمَهُ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: مَنْ ظَلَمَ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ كَانَ اللَّهُ خَصْمَهُ دُونَ عِبَادِهِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: مِنْ أَفْحَشِ الظُّلْمِ ظُلْمُ الْكِرَامِ
enWisdom: One of the most grievous injustices is the injustice of [or against] the honourable ones

Wisdom: لَا سَوْءَةَ كَالظُّلْمِ
enWisdom: There is no evil like injustice

Wisdom: لَا صَلَاحَ مَعَ إِفْسَادٍ
enWisdom: There is no rectitude with corruption

Wisdom: يَنَامُ الرَّجُلُ عَلَى الثُّكْلِ وَلَا يَنَامُ عَلَى الظُّلْمِ
enWisdom: A man may sleep after the loss of a child but he will not sleep under [the yoke of] oppression

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ يُعِينُ عَلَى الْمَظْلُومِ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who assists [the oppressor] against the oppressed

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنِ ادَّرَعَ اللُّؤْمَ وَنَصَرَ الظَّلُومَ
enWisdom: The worst person is he who puts on the armour of vileness and helps the unjust

Wisdom: مَنْ أَعَانَ عَلَى مُسْلِمٍ [مُؤْمِنٍ‏] فَقَدْ بَرِئَ مِنَ الْإِسْلَامِ
enWisdom: One who assists [a disbeliever] against a Muslim has indeed exited from the fold of Islam
